title: Everything coming to Netflix in September — and what’s leaving
text:
Netflix Inc. is ushering in the fall with plenty of long-time favorites and binge-friendly originals.

Joining the streaming service’s NFLX, -1.02% roster in September are the second and third installments of “The Lord of the Rings” trilogy; “American Psycho”; the ninth season of “Shameless”; and Season 9 of “The Walking Dead.” Originals include Chelsea Handler’s documentary “Hello, Privilege. It’s Me, Chelsea”; a “Between Two Ferns” movie starring funnyman Zach Galifianakis; and Ryan Murphy’s “The Politician,” starring Ben Platt and Gwyneth Paltrow.

Netflix will also release “Unbelievable,” based on an article published in 2015 by ProPublica and The Marshall Project about Marie, a young woman who reported being raped by a man who broke into her apartment and later recanted her account under pressure from police detectives.

Read: Opinion: Netflix stock is a buy right now — for these 10 reasons

Also: Imperial cuts Netflix stock price target on reports it has failed to secure wide release for Scorsese’s ‘The Irishman’

Viewers will have until Sept. 1 to catch films like “Batman Begins” and “The Dark Knight” before they leave the service. Also leaving: three of the “Fast and Furious” movies (“The Fast and the Furious, “2 Fast 2 Furious” and “The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift”); “Meet Joe Black”; Disney’s “Mulan” and “Pocahontas”; and “The Hangover.”

Don’t miss: Dwayne Johnson beat all of the Avengers to be the highest-paid actor in the world
